Sent for the information of
NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
14 GREGORY HALL
URBANA, ILLINOIS
April k, 1957
Dr. Harry Newburn
Educational Television and Radio Center
1610 Washtenaw Avenue
Ann Arbor, Michigan
Dear Harry:
Since becoming president of NARB, I have been re-examining
the functions of our various coimnittees, Perhaps it would be a
good idea, therefore, if you and I jointly tried to define the
role of the Advisory Committee to President of the BTRC.
As you will recall, I was the chairman of the original
committee appointed back In 1953. Then our problem was that of
setting up the Center, Now, it seems to me, the committee^ main
role is to provide liaison between the Center and its members, and
the Center and NAEB.
I can think of several specific contributions the Committee
might make. In the first place, the criticisms we hear occasion¬
ally of the Center, from people both inside and outside the
educational television movement, are certainly our concern. If
they are justified, perhaps we can help you meet them. On the
other hand, if the Center Is doing all it can on a given matter,
and still is receiving unmerited criticism, we should be prepared
to speak in your defense.
We also should provide NAEB-STRC liaison. If educational
broadcasting Is to be strong, it must remain unified: we should be
one group of educational broadcasters, rather than competing groups
of radio and television broadcasters. Perhaps this committee can
sometimes help close the ranks.
When and how often we should meet? Between now and Columbus
we shall be pretty much snowed under by the NAEB Radio Seminar,
the Columbus meeting Itself, and your Affiliates meeting. I
assume that Schooley, Hunter, Hull — and perhaps Robertson —
will attend the Affiliates meeting. Perhaps I should come along
and listen In; what do you think? (not to the exclusion of Harry
Skornia, or any other regular guests from NAEB, however.) Perhaps
this committee could have lunch with you on Tuesday noon, May l1*,
could meet by ourselves that evening, and then you and I could
have a final session on the morning of the 15th.
